docs.snippet: An adviser to U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump's campaign said on Sunday that Trump will meet with Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi on Monday during the United Nations General Assembly, just as Hillary Clinton, the Democrat...
docs.lead_paragraph: An adviser to U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump's campaign said on Sunday that Trump will meet with Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi on Monday during the United Nations General Assembly, just as Hillary Clinton, the Democratic presidential nominee, is also scheduled to do.

headline.main: Clinton, Trump to Both Meet With Egyptian President at U.N.
headline.print_headline: Clinton, Trump to Both Meet With Egyptian President at U.N.

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton's campaign is aggressively outworking Donald Trump in battleground Pennsylvania, a state the billionaire businessman can scarcely afford to lose and still hope to become president....

headline.main: Clinton Outdoing Trump in Pennsylvania, a Must-Win State
headline.print_headline: Clinton Outdoing Trump in Pennsylvania, a Must-Win State

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama on Sunday praised Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton for her intellect, fortitude and "unerring" judgment and blasted "the other guy," Republican Donald Trump, on his New York home turf as unqualified to be pr...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama on Sunday praised Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton for her intellect, fortitude and "unerring" judgment and blasted "the other guy," Republican Donald Trump, on his New York home turf as unqualified to be president and uninterested in learning enough to make the hard decisions the job requires.

headline.main: Obama Praises Clinton, Blasts Trump at DNC Fundraiser in NYC
headline.print_headline: Obama Praises Clinton, Blasts Trump at DNC Fundraiser in NYC

docs.snippet: Despite signs of a tightening national presidential race, Hillary Clinton still appears to have an advantage in enough states to give her an Electoral College victory. It's an edge that could still change as advance voting gets underway in earnest...
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite signs of a tightening national presidential race, Hillary Clinton still appears to have an advantage in enough states to give her an Electoral College victory. It's an edge that could still change as advance voting gets underway in earnest and in the seven weeks until Election Day.

headline.main: How AP Rates the Presidential Race and the Road to 270

docs.snippet: The next commander in chief will face no good options in Afghanistan. But we need a plan that is better than the current policy....
docs.lead_paragraph: The next commander in chief will face no good options in Afghanistan. But we need a plan that is better than the current policy.
docs.abstract: Editorials highlights absence of Afghanistan as prominent issue in presidential campaign, despite fact Obama administration's current plans will commit United States to maintaining troop presence in country for foreseeable future; underscores necessity of serious discussion about next administration's policy for Afghanistan (Series: Left Unsaid).
